article.title: Biathlon_World_Championships

template.arg: IPC Biathlon and Cross-Country Skiing World Championships

article.paragraph: The firstBiathlonWorld Championships (BWCH)was held in 1958, with individual and team contests for men. The number of events has grown significantly over the years. Beginning in 1984, women biathletes had their own World Championships, and finally, from 1989, both genders have been participating in joint BWCHs. In 1978 the development was enhanced by the change from the large army rifle calibre to a small bore rifle, while the range to the target was reduced from 150 to 50 meters.
article.heading: BWCH venues
article.paragraph: The season's BWCHs takes place during February or March. Some years it has been necessary to schedule parts of the Championships at other than the main venue because of weather and/or snow conditions. Full, joint BWCHs have never been held inWinter Olympic GamesOlympic Winter Gamesseasons. BWCHs in non-IOC events, however, have been held in Olympic seasons. In 2005, the then new event of Mixed Relay (two legs done by women, two legs by men) was arranged separately from the ordinary Championships.

list.listitem: Biathlon World Championships 19671967flagiconEast GermanyAltenberg, SaxonyAltenberg,East Germany

Biathlon World Championships 20092009flagiconSouth KoreaPyeongchang CountyPyeongchang,South Korea
Biathlon World Championships 20132013flagiconCzech RepublicNov Msto na Morav,Czech Republic

article.heading: Men
Individual (20 km)
article.paragraph: This event was first held in 1958.
article.heading: Sprint (10 km)
article.paragraph: This event was first held in 1974.
article.heading: Pursuit (12.5 km)
article.paragraph: This event was first held in 1997.
article.heading: Mass start (15 km)
article.paragraph: This event was first held in 1999.
article.heading: Relay (4 7.5 km)
article.paragraph: This event was first held unofficially inBiathlon World Championships 19651965. It was a success, and replacedthe team competition as an official event in 1966.
article.heading: Team (time)
article.paragraph: This event was held from 1958 to 1965. The times of the top 3 athletes from each country in the 20 km individual were added together(in 1958 the top 4).
article.heading: Team
article.paragraph: This event, a patrol race, was held from 1989 to 1998. 1989-93: 20 km. 1994-98: 10 km.
article.heading: Women
Individual (15 km)
article.paragraph: This event was first held in 1984. Through 1988 the distance was 10 km.
article.heading: Sprint (7.5 km)
article.paragraph: This event was first held in 1984. Through 1988 the distance was 5 km.

article.heading: Pursuit (10 km)
article.paragraph: This event was first held in 1997.

tablerow.tablecell: flag athl iocc[[Sandrine Bailly]]FRA,flag athl iocc[[Martina Beck|Martina Glagow]]GER

article.heading: Mass start (12.5 km)
article.paragraph: This event was first held in 1999.

template.arg: [[Gro Marit Istad Kristiansen|Gro M. Istad Kristiansen]]

article.heading: Relay (4 6 km)
article.paragraph: This event was first held in 1984. Through 1988, the event was 3 5 km. 1989-91: 3 7.5 km. 1993-2001: 4 7.5 km. In 2003, the leg distance was set to 6 km.
article.heading: Team
article.paragraph: This event, a patrol race, was held from 1989 to 1998. 1989-93: 15 km. 1994-98: 7.5 km.
article.heading: Mixed
Relay (2 6 km + 2 7.5 km)
article.paragraph: This event was first held in 2005, at theBiathlon World Cupfinals inKhanty-Mansiysk. In 2005 the women biathletes did the first two legs, and the men did the following two, while in 2006 the sequence was woman–man–woman–man. At theBiathlon World Championships 2007inRasen-AntholzAntholz, the sequence was women–women–man–man. The men ski legs of 7.5 km (in 2005-06: 6 km) and the women ski 6 km each. From 2007 only one team per nation is allowed to compete.
